Content:: A fanlight is a form of lunette window, often semicircular or semi-elliptical in shape, with glazing bars or tracery sets radiating out like an open fan.[1] It is placed over another window or a doorway,[2][3] and is sometimes hinged to a transom. The bars in the fixed glazed window spread out in the manner of a sunburst. It is also called a "sunburst light".[4] Main door and fanlight, Joseph Priestley House in Northumberland, Pennsylvania City gate Milan, Italy Pal√°cio Nacional da Pena, Sintra, Portugal Hotel, Ariah Park, New South Wales Fanlight over door with side lights  This architectural element–related article is a stub.
